Field Detail

SPIN_LOOP_SLEEP_MS

public static final int SPIN_LOOP_SLEEP_MS
The time (in milliseconds) to sleep when inside a spin forever loop. Why 60 seconds? Why not? Could pick any arbitrarily large number.

See Also:

Method Detail

getTimestampNow

public static final java.lang.String getTimestampNow()
Get the time now in a string format suitable for use in SOX timestamp fields.

Returns:
UTC timestamp to the nearest millisecond as a string.

getTimestampFromUnixTime

public static final java.lang.String getTimestampFromUnixTime(long timestampMsUtc)
Convert from "unix time" (utc milliseconds since 1970) into a string format for use in SOX timestamp fields.

Parameters:
timestampMsUtc - utc time in milliseconds since Jan 1, 1970 (aka unix time).
Returns:
UTC timestamp to the nearest millisecond as a string.

getUnixTimeFromTimestamp

public static final long getUnixTimeFromTimestamp(java.lang.String timestamp)
Convert from a SOX string timestamp into a "unix timestamp" (milliseconds since 1970).

Parameters:
timestamp - as a SOX string (i.e. from a timestamp field).
Returns:
milliseconds since Jan 1, 1970 UTC.

verifyTimestamp

public static final java.lang.String verifyTimestamp(java.lang.String timestamp)
                                              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Verify that the string provided is a valid RFC 3339 timestamp string and converts the string into the UTC timezone for use by the SOX library.

Parameters:
timestamp - string to be verified.
Returns:
timestamp converted to UTC in the SOX format.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the string cannot be converted to UTC.

simpleSleepMs

public static final boolean simpleSleepMs(int sleepMs)
